Meta.ShortDescription: A low level of folic acid and derivatives in the body. Also known as vitamin B9, folate is involved in adenosine, guanine, and thymidine synthesis (part of DNA synthesis).

Relations.Relation: Possible relation of B9/B12 deficiency to major depressive disorder

Causes.Cause: When the body's need for folate is increased
When the body excretes more folate than usual
Mediations that interfere with the body's ability to use folate
A defect in homocysteine methyltransferase or a dificiency of B12

Diagnostics.Diagnostic: Blood test for B9 and/or B12

Treatments.Treatment: Ensure adequate levels of folate in diet
Steaming vegetables helps keep more folate content
